name: Imperial Legionnaire

aspects.trouble: Far From Home in Hostile Land

stunts: Testudo Formation: When fighting in formation with other Legionnaires, gain Armor:2 against ranged attacks
Imperial Discipline: +2 to Will when resisting fear or intimidation
Professional Soldier: +2 to Fight when defending a fortified position
notes: Imperial Legionnaires are professional soldiers of the Cyrodilic Empire. They are better trained and equipped than most Stormcloaks, with superior discipline and tactics. They excel at holding fortified positions and fighting in formation. Their armor provides base protection (Armor:1), and their Testudo formation grants additional defense against ranged attacks.
combat_tactics: Legionnaires fight with discipline and coordination. They prefer shield walls and defensive formations, using archers to soften enemies before engagement. They follow orders precisely and retreat in good order if commanded. They're trained to hold ground and will fight to the last man if ordered.

loot.group_loot: Imperial camps contain well-organized supplies worth 50-150 gold, superior weapons, and military intelligence

variants.name: Imperial Centurion
variants.changes: Increase Fight to Superb (+5), add stunt 'Tactical Commander: All allies within the same zone gain +1 to Fight', add fourth stress box

variants.name: Imperial Archer
variants.changes: Increase Shoot to Great (+4), replace Testudo with 'Suppressing Fire: +2 to Create Advantage using Shoot to pin down enemies'

variants.name: Legate
variants.changes: Increase all skills by +1, add stunt 'Voice of Authority: +3 to Provoke when giving orders to Imperial soldiers', becomes named NPC with full consequence slots

social_interaction: Legionnaires are professional and follow orders. They can be reasoned with using logic, appeals to law and order, or proper military protocol. They respect chain of command and duty. Generally neutral on Skyrim politics personally but will enforce Empire's will. Dislike the Thalmor but obey the Concordat.

personality_notes.speaking_style: Military, formal, uses ranks and protocol, pragmatic
